Package com.atakmap.coremap.filesystem

Class FileSystemUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.coremap.filesystem.FileSystemUtils
  • public class FileSystemUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Centralize the definition of root file system on the File System.

      • getRoot

        public static java.io.File getRoot()
        Get the location where all ATAK information should reside. Each call returns a new File object representing the root directory.

      • getItem

        public static java.io.File getItem​(java.lang.String path)
        Used to obtain a resource on the file system within the ATAK base directory. The return result is the internal memory for which the atak directory exists.
        Parameters:
        path - is the name of the directory or file using File.separatorChar to delineate between path elements.

      • getItems

        public static java.io.File[] getItems​(java.lang.String path)
        Used to obtain a resource on the file system within any ATAK directory. The result is all possible combinations of the atak directory with the path appended.
        Parameters:
        path - is the name of the directory or file using File.separatorChar to delineate between path elements.

      • getRoot

        public static java.io.File getRoot​(java.io.File file)
        Get the location where all ATAK information should reside, on same SD card as specified file.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Fully resets the caches used by the FileSystemUtils. Do not call unless you know what you are doing. This method is not synchronized and should not be considered safe to use in a case where other libraries are actively using FileSystemUtils when this is called.

      • findMountPoints

        public static java.lang.String[] findMountPoints()
        Gather list of mounts that may contain ATAK data First time it is called, create data directory if "ATAK" import folder exists Note: findMountPoints caches the result of the initial run and does not perform any additional attempts to scan for new mount points. see: http ://stackoverflow.com/questions/8688382/runtime-exec-bug-hangs-without-providing-a-process- object which describes a real issue we are seeing on the Note 1's running the persistent systems rom. specifically: https://github.com/android/platform_bionic/blob/jb-release/libc/bionic/cpuacct.c If a non-cached version is desired, run reset() and then call findMountPoints. (NOT RECOMMENDED)
        Returns:
        list of mount points (ATAK data dir included in path)

      • migrate

        public static void migrate​(java.lang.String oldFile,
                           java.lang.String newFile)
        Loop all mount points, attempt to migrate old file or directory to new, on same mount
        Parameters:
        oldFile - the old mount point
        newFile - the new mount point

        NullSafe list comparison for determining string equality. In this case list equality for a list does depend on order and also contains the same values.
        Parameters:
        lhs - the left hand list
        rhs - the right hand list
        Returns:
        true if they are equals

      • getRandomFilepath

        public static java.lang.String getRandomFilepath​(java.lang.String filePath)
        Get new filepath with 8 random characters on end of file name
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path to serve as the base for the generated random file path
        Returns:
        a randomized file path

      • sanitizeFilename

        public static java.lang.String sanitizeFilename​(java.lang.String s)
        Prepare for DB storage and use as a filename restrict characters during input i.e. alphanumeric and various allowed filename characters.

        This also removes any occurance of .. which could potentially be used for a filename manipulation attack.

        Parameters:
        s - the input filename
        Returns:
        the sanitized filename

      • isAcceptableInFilename

        public static boolean isAcceptableInFilename​(java.lang.Character c)
        Test if the given character will pass unaltered in a call to sanitizeFilename(). Note that this can only test the single character out of context; the character may still be removed in a later call to sanitizeFilename() if it is part of a disallowed sequence of multiple characters.
        Parameters:
        c - character to test
        Returns:
        true if character is acceptable for filenames (on its own), false otherwise

      • sanitizeWithSpaces

        public static java.lang.String sanitizeWithSpaces​(java.lang.String s)
        Prepare for DB storage and use restrict characters during input i.e. alphanumeric and various allowed filename characters.

        This also removes any occurance of .. which could potentially be used for a filename manipulation attack.

        Parameters:
        s - the original string
        Returns:
        the string sanitized

      • sanitizeWithSpacesAndSlashes

        public static java.lang.String sanitizeWithSpacesAndSlashes​(java.lang.String s)
        Prepare for DB storage, restrict characters during input i.e. alphanumeric and '$' and '+' and '#' and '.' and '-' and '_' and ' ' and File.separatorChar. This also removes any occurrence of .. which could potentially be used for a filename manipulation attack.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to sanitize.
        Returns:
        the sanitized string without any .. and other characters not listed above.

      • canWrite

        public static boolean canWrite​(java.io.File directory)
        Checks to see if the specified directory is writable. This method will attempt to actually write a file in the directory, overcoming the shortcomings of File.canWrite() , which simply checks the file permissions.
        Parameters:
        directory - A directory
        Returns:
        true if the directory is writable, false otherwise.

      • zipDirectory

        public static java.io.File zipDirectory​(java.io.File dir,
                                        java.io.File dest,
                                        boolean compress)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Compress the directory contents into a ZIP file
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to zip.
        dest - the destination file.
        compress - True to compress the ZIP, false to store
        Returns:
        the destination file if the zip is successful, otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case there are any io exceptions.

      • zipDirectory

        public static java.io.File zipDirectory​(java.io.File dir,
                                        java.io.File dest,
                                        boolean compress,
                                        java.io.FilenameFilter ignore)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Compress the directory contents into a ZIP file
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to zip.
        dest - the destination file.
        compress - True to compress the ZIP, false to store
        ignore - [optional] filter to ignore/skip, not place matching files in the zip
        Returns:
        the destination file if the zip is successful, otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case there are any io exceptions.

      • getFileData

        public static boolean getFileData​(java.io.File derivedFrom,
                                  FileSystemUtils.FileTreeData result,
                                  long limit)
        Walk a tree recursively and grab all of the File information to come up with a total file size and most recent modified.
        Parameters:
        derivedFrom - the directory or file to start with
        result - the total size of all of the files and the most recent last modified
        limit - the maxinum number of file s to process
        Returns:
        true if the maximum number of files was not hit, false if the maximum number of files was exceeded.

        The number of files in a directory tree.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of files in a directory tree.

      • validityScan

        public static java.lang.String validityScan​(java.lang.String fileName,
                                            java.lang.String[] exts)
                                     throws FileSystemUtils.FileNameInvalid
        Fortify Validity check for String filenames so they cannot contain path manipulation characters.

        If the following string is expected to have a specific extension, if no extension is specified then the file is still checked for sanity. The extension list that is passed in contains extensions that are not dotted.

        Throws:
        FileSystemUtils.FileNameInvalid
